snippet: Investment funds that take into account environmental, social and corporate governance criteria have experienced explosive growth in the last five years.
abstract: Anna Bernasek DataPoints column observes that sustainable and responsible investments, or SRI's, have surged in popularity; notes that such funds, which take into account environmental, social and corporate governance criteria, have surged to 720 in 2012 from only 260 in 2007.
lead_paragraph: Investment funds that take into account environmental, social and corporate governance criteria have experienced explosive growth in the last five years.
